book.title: A Gift of Serenity
book.author: John Ellis
book.subtitle: A Literary Psychological Thriller of Memory and Redemption
book.description: On a remote English island, a man haunted by memory loss and guilt sets out on a walking pilgrimage, hoping to find peace while the past stalks close behind. Caught between psychological suspense, romance, and the search for healing, his journey weaves locked-room mystery tension with the intimate pulse of redemption and love. Both a gripping thriller and a layered meditation on grief, resilience, and second chances, this is a story for readers who crave suspense laced with emotional depth.

analysisOverview.title: Analysis Overview
analysisOverview.readership: The book attracts a broad yet focused readership: younger adults drawn in by themes of influencer burnout and contemporary pressures, and mature audiences resonating with grief, therapy, and redemption. Its appeal lies in crossing boundariesâ€”thriller fans gain psychological depth, literary readers find a page-turning plot, and romance audiences connect with love-after-loss tropes. Engagement is amplified by BookTok, book clubs, and audiobook consumption, ensuring strong reach across both niche and mainstream channels.
analysisOverview.classification: Positioned as a literary psychological thriller, the book is mapped through a bespoke subgenre taxonomy, highlighting its strong placement in Locked Island Thrillers, Therapy Journey Fiction, and Memory Loss Mysteries. This tailored classification confirms its hybrid appeal: suspenseful, morally complex, and emotionally resonant.
analysisOverview.personas: Two personas bring the audience to life: The Reflective Seeker, embodying mature, spiritually minded readers seeking catharsis, and The Dark Aesthete, representing younger, creative urban readers drawn to psychological intensity and stylish transgression. The primary personaâ€”the Reflective Seekerâ€”reveals that the book's core strength lies in offering meaning, depth, and redemption.
analysisOverview.marketingGuidance: Marketing insights emphasise suspense-driven hooks and healing-centred messages, allowing campaigns to balance mystery with emotional payoff. This first report provides foundational guidance for copy and creative, while future iterations will expand into a dedicated marketing product with richer assets and tested playbooks.
